title: Rainforest Animals
passage: A rainforest is a wet, warm place where many different plants and animals live. It is home to thousands of species, some of which are not found anywhere else in the world. Rainforests are vital to our planet's health.

questions.text: What is the main idea of the passage?

title: Ocean Life
passage: The ocean is a vast body of salt water that covers more than 70% of the Earth's surface. It is home to countless species of fish, mammals, and other organisms. The ocean plays a crucial role in regulating the Earth's climate.
